text: Hey there!
I'm Kate, and we're MinuteEarth.

We use stick figures, science, and puns to
explain what we know about our planet, and
how we know it.

More often than not, when we tell people that
we make a living by producing videos and distributing

them for free online, their first question
is, 'so how do you get money?'

And the truth is, while we have some consistent
revenue coming in from our viewers and from

ads, we’ve gotten really lucky with sponsorships
and other funding opportunities.

But the Internet is a constantly changing
ecosystem, and over the last year, some of

our bigger sources of funding have greatly
diminished and others have disappeared, leaving

us unsure whether we’ll be able to keep
making MinuteEarth.

And that’s really sad - we love making videos,
but what we love even more is that YOU love
our videos.

We love being able to make videos for a living,
and for you!

And that's why we want to keep making them...but
we need your help.

If you support rigorous, fact-checked science
videos with a side of silliness, will you

contribute whatever you can - even if it's
just a dollar - for every new video we make?

You can do it on Patreon, an incredible website
where people like you support creators like
us.

If you already support us on Patreon, you
can help us by raising the monthly maximum

on your pledge - but in any case, thank you
for your continued support!

We want to post videos more often, and to
spend more time talking with you and finding
out what topics you guys are curious about.

If you want to be a part of all of this, please
support us on Patreon.com/MinuteEarth.

Thank you for helping MinuteEarth “stick”
around.
